Quoting tumb@...:

> Your ValueCollector class is added to the needed class in order to
> make
> public some private or method field in the needed class, isn't it? 
> 
> Is it really OK to add this ValueCollector class (and instance) to
> your
> production code for testing purposes?

Re-read the paragraph after that, the one starting, "If I'm forcing myself to 
do a good job..." The ValueCollector is something that drives a wedge into the 
design, identifying a much-needed refactoring. If I'm willing to take on the 
refactoring (for example, because the code I'm testing is important), then I 
do; otherwise, the ValueCollector is a constant reminder that the code is 
nonsense and needs work.

J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
